paper_abstract: The power-law regularities have been discovered behind many complex natural and social phenomenons. We discover that the power-law regularities, especially the Zipf's and Heaps' laws, also exist in large-scale software systems. We find that the distribution of lexical tokens in modern Java, C(++) and C programs follows Zipf-Mandelbrot law, and the growth of program vocabulary follows Heaps' law. The results are obtained through empirical analysis of real-world software systems. We believe our discovery reveals the statistical regularities behind computer programming. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. paper_title: Discovering power laws in computer programs
